pages.text: An incredibly strong metal forged from the $(l:innovation/metallurgy/steel)crude steel iron alloy$(), infused with $(item)dragon blood$(), and forged through the breath of an active, living $(l:slayers_journal/beastiary/dragon)dragon$() in an appropriately constructed dragon forge.$(br2)The more common variant is $(item)fire dragonsteel$(), though $(item)ice dragonsteel$() can also be

forged from the ice dragon variation.$(br2)Each are appropriately made in their own unique dragon forges which also need to be powered by their corresponding dragon variant.$(br2) In order to construct this forge, I will need:$(br)• 17 $(item)dragonforge bricks$()$(br)• 1 $(item)dragon forge core$() and$(br)• 1 $(item)dragon aperture$() input

pages.name: Fire Dragonforge
pages.text: A structure formed by the scales and bones of $(#f7430c)fire dragons$() with the heart of one as the core

pages.name: Ice Dragonforge
pages.text: A structure formed by the scales and bones of $(#0fbfae)ice dragons$() with the heart of one as the core

Once I've completed the construction of a dragon forge, I can power it by $(item)chaining$() a wild dragon to a dragonbone wall nearby, but this is incredibly dangerous. A better alternative would be to use a tamed dragon instead.
